BallTreePointSet class¶

class BallTreePointSet.BallTreePointSet(points, path=None, intensity=None, range_accuracy=0.002, angle_accuracy=0.012, measurement_accuracy=0.002, leaf_size=40, **kwargs)[source]¶
__init__(points, path=None, intensity=None, range_accuracy=0.002, angle_accuracy=0.012, measurement_accuracy=0.002, leaf_size=40, **kwargs)[source]¶

A ball tree representation

Parameters:
  • points (PointSet, np.array) – the points to represent as ball tree
  • leaf_size (int) – minimal number of points in a leaf, with the maximal \(2\cdot\) leaf_size

Attributes

Methods

param crs: coordinate spatial reference, if exists

_BallTreePointSet__ComputeNodeLevel(index) Compute the level of a node in the tree defined by its index.

Parameters: index – the index of the point to return
Returns: specific point/s as numpy nX3 ndarray

Returns: number of points

Return type: nx1 nd-array

Return type: nx1 nd-array
Z¶
Returns: Z coordinates
Return type: nx1 nd-array
ballTreeLeaves¶

Retrieving the indexes of the nodes which are leaves :return: A list of indexes for all the nodes which are leaves

getLeftChildOfNode(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the index of the left child node of a given node

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose left child is required
Returns: The index of the left child node or None, if the node does not have a left child
Return type: int, None

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose level is required
Returns: The level of the node
Return type: int
getNodeRadius(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the radius of a node given by its index

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose radius is requested
Returns: The radius of the node
Return type: float
getParentOfNode(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the index of the parent node of a given node

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose parent is required
Returns: The index of the parent node or None, if the node does not have a parent (node is the root)
Return type: int, None
getPointsOfNode(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the indexes of the points in a given node

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose points are required
Returns: list of indexes of the points in the node
Return type: list
getRightChildOfNode(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the index of the right child node of a given node

Returns: The index of the right child node or None, if the node does not have a right child
Return type: int, None
getSiblingOfNode(index)[source]¶

Retrieve the index of the sibling node of a given node

Parameters: index (int) – The index of the node whose sibling is required
Returns: The index of the sibling node or None, if the node does not have a sibling
Return type: int, None
getSmallestNodesOfSize(radius, startingNode='root')[source]¶

Get a list of the smallest nodes whose radii are larger than a given radius

Parameters:
  • radius (float) – The minimal required size of the nodes
  • startingNode (str) – Starting node for the search of the smallest node. Can be ‘root’ (top-down) or ‘leaves’ (bottom-up). Default: ‘root’
Returns:

list of the smallest nodes indices (ints)
Return type:

list (int), None
maxLevel¶

Retrieve the maximum level of the tree

Returns: maximum level of the tree
Return type: int
numberOfNodes¶

Retrieve the total number of nodes in the ball tree

Returns: The number of nodes in the ball tree
query(pnts, k)[source]¶

Query the ball tree for the k nearest neighbors of a given set of points

Parameters:
  • pnts (np.array nx3) – The query points
  • k (int) – The number of neighbors to find for the point
Returns:

The indexes for the neighbors of the points
Return type:

list of np.array

Note

Return the query points themselves as the first index of each list

queryRadius(pnts, radius)[source]¶

Query the ball tree to find the neighbors of a given set of point inside a given radius

Parameters:
  • pnts (np.array nx3) – The query points
  • radius (float) – The query radius
Returns:

The indexes for the neighbors of the points
Return type:

list of np.array

Note

Return the query points themselves as the first index of each list
